channel.title: Posts on Haozhe Su
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Haozhe Su

item.title: Code for Weakly-Supervised GANs (WS-GAN)
item.description: Checkout the code on Github PyTorch code for “Learning Facial Attribute Modeling with Weakly Supervised GANs”. The code is largely based on CycleGAN and pix2pix.

item.title: Code for Supervised GANs (SGAN)
item.description: Checkout the code on Github PyTorch code for “Learning Generative Models of Tissue Organization with Supervised GANs”. The code is largely based on CycleGAN and pix2pix.

item.title: MatConvNet modules for 2-D RNNs (LSTM, GRU)
item.description: Checkout the code on Github Implementation of various 2-D RNN modules is included: 2-D RNN 2-D LSTM Vanilla With “peephole connections“ With coupled forget and input gates 2-D GRU

item.title: Gomoku
item.description: Checkout the code on Github GUI and CLI interface A simple implementation of AI player Play remotely through socket interface How to use Simply run: $ python gomoku.py or a CLI version (pretty much forked from Skywind): $ python gomoku_cli.py and enjoy! Game control and settings Change player types in gomoku.py: PLTYP1 = 'human' PLTYP2 = 'computer' Music and sound effect: play_music = True play_sound = True Acknowledgement AI code adopted from here by Skywind.

item.title: Tools for Axis Label Alignment in MATLAB
item.description: Checkout the code on File Exchange or Github This is a simple MATLAB function for axis label alignment. If you have ever struggled with the label alignment issue in MATLAB’s 3-D plots — by default axis labels are placed horizontally no matter how you rotate the plot — here is a simple fix. It still works when Projection mode is Perspective or when DataAspectRatio is not [1 1 1].

item.title: Tools for 2-D Tomographic Reconstruction
item.description: Checkout the code on File Exchange or Github There are two main methods for tomographic reconstruction: 1. Filtered back-projection or FBP which is based on Radon transform and its inverse transform; 2. Algebraic reconstruction technique or ART which is based on solving linear algebra equations. The MATLAB code contains functions for both FBPs and ARTs (the built-in lsqr solver is recommended): tomo_projection_2d, computes projections of a given image; build_weight_matrix, builds weighting factor matrix used for algebraic methods; tomo_reconstruction_bp, reconstructs the image from its projections using BP method; tomo_reconstruction_fbp, reconstructs the image from its projections using FBP method; tomo_reconstruction_art, reconstructs the image from its projections using ART method; tomo_reconstruction_sart, reconstructs the image from its projections using SART method; tomo_reconstruction_lsqr, reconstructs the image from its projections, using the build-in lsqr solver.
